page.title: 01The Glenkiln Area
page.content: This region consists of moorland and rough grassland crossed by valley of the Old Water. From Hills in the north-west to lower, more enclosed farmland to the south and east. There are small patches of broad leafed woodland and some conifer plantations, but none of these cover a very large area. It is a quiet,rural district,remote in parts,yet has a well kept appearance, most of the local people work on the land. There is a dam at Glenkiln creating a reservoir, which is the principal water supply for Dumfries. Although man made, the reservoir blends naturally with its beautiful surroundings. The scenery is enhanced by some modern sculptures by Henry Moore,sited in open air at various locations,eyecatching feature of area.
